data.meanings: To think, suppose, doubt, assume, deem, believe, know, imagine, suspect, conjunctive, be sure of something in view of one's observations. As a general rule often this verb is succeeded by 'anna or 'an, that means to be sure about.. . Zanna (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing, assim.): He thought, imagined, deemed, assumed, believed, conjectured, suspected; He was sure.. Zanantu (prf. 1st, p.m. sing.): I was sure.. Zannaa  (prf. 3rd. p.m. dual.): The twain thought.. Zannuu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They imagined.. Zanantum (prf. 2nd p.m. plu.): Ye thought.. Zananna (prf. 1st. p. plu.): We thought.. Yazunnu (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He thinks.. Tazunnu (imp. 3rd. p. f. sing.): She thinks.. Azunnu (imp. 1st. P. sing.): I think.. Yazunnuuna (imp. 3rd, p. in. plu.): They know, believe, conjuncture.. Tazunnuuna (imp. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You entertained wrong thoughts.. Nazunnu (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We deem.. Zannun/Zannan  (nom./acc.n.): Thinking; Conjecture.. Zunuuna (n. plu.): Diverse thoughts.. Zaanniina (act. pic. n. plu.): Entertainers of evil thought..

As a general rule often this verb is succeeded by 'anna or 'an, that means to be sure about.. . Zanna (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing, assim.): He thought, imagined, deemed, assumed, believed, conjectured, suspected; He was sure.. Zanantu (prf. 1st, p.m. sing.): I was sure.. Yazunnu (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He thinks.. Tazunnu (imp. 3rd. p. f. sing.): She thinks.. Azunnu (imp. 1st. P. sing.): I think.. Yazunnuuna (imp. 3rd, p. in. plu.): They know, believe, conjuncture.. Tazunnuuna (imp. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You entertained wrong thoughts.. Nazunnu (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We deem.. Zannun/Zannan  (nom./acc.n.): Thinking; Conjecture.. Zunuuna (n. plu.): Diverse thoughts.. Zaanniina (act. pic. n. plu.): Entertainers of evil thought..

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word وَقَالُوا comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word عِلْمٍ comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.

data.meanings: To happen. Dahrun, plu. Duhur: Time (short or long); Beginning of time; Year; Event; Time from the beginning of the world to its end; Epoch; Vicissitudes of time; Calamity; Fate; as time brings to pass events; Good or evil.
data.sentence: The word الدَّهْرُ comes from the root د ه ر and is associated with the meanings: To happen. Dahrun, plu. Duhur: Time (short or long); Beginning of time; Year; Event; Time from the beginning of the world to its end; Epoch; Vicissitudes of time; Calamity; Fate; as time brings to pass events; Good or evil.
